patterns: How do I apply for the fellowships listed on the Jackson website?'
How can I pay for the school?
What are the opportunities for scholarship, fellowship or other forms of funding?
responses: In my  opinion, Jackson is very generous in terms of funding. I do not want to be so technical, but 100% of Jackson students who requested financial aid received it, with an average of $47,800! How can you be considered for funding? Just make sure that you check the appropriate box in the application!

I think Jackson offers very generous funding for its students. It shows in the statistics on our website! 100% of Jackson students who requested financial aid received it, with an average of $47,800! Oh, how can you be considered in the first place? You can simply check the box in the application!

I understand that it is stressful to think about funding even before you get into the school! But it is an important part of your study. I would be happy to help you! Make sure you check the appropriate box in the application to be considered!

patterns: I am currently an undergraduate student, may I still apply?
How many years of professional experience should I have to be considered?
How many years of work experience required to apply for Jackson?
responses: I am glad that you are considering Jackson at the very early stage of your career! Thank you so much! Of course, you can apply as a current college student. However, most of the students have 3-4 years of professional experience.

It is a difficult quesiton to answer to be honest. Technically, you can apply as a graduating senior in college! However, please be mindful that most of the current students have at least 3-4 years of work experience before joining Jackson

Welcome! I am happy to hear that you are considering Jackson! However, I would recommend having 1-2 years of work experience after college unles syou are applying as part of a relevant fellowship or program. Is it helpful?

patterns: I have been preparing to apply for the M.A. in Global Affairs at Jackson, but cannot find reference to that degree option on the Jackson website anymore. What happened to it?
I know that Jackson offered M.A. program in global affairs. However, now it only offers M.P.P MPP Mater in Public Policy program. Can you tell me what happened?
Does Jackson offer M.P.P Master in Public Policy or M.A. Master in Global Affairs
responses: Hey! Thank you for your question! Let me explain this in a simple way. In short, Jackson no longer offers M.A. programs in Global Affairs. Instead, now it offers M.P.P. program.

I am glad that you asked this question! As Jackson became a professional school in Fall 2022, JAckson decided to launch Master in Public Policy (M.P.P.) programs instead of M.A. programs in Global Affairs.
First of all, sorry for the confusion. In fact, Jackson no longer offers M.A. programs in Global Affairs. Instead, now it offers M.P.P. program.

patterns: I want to talk to the admission. What would be the best way to do it?
What event does Jackson have for admission?
Is there admission event that I can join or participate in?
responses: Of course! Jackson provides a lot of ways that you can reach out! First, I think it would be good idea for you to check previous recorded webinars on the website. It should give you some ideas about the program and admission process. Second, you can also join those webinars yourself in the future! Lastly, I recommend you to check the admission calender on the website so that you can join either in person or through zoom.

It is a great idea to meet people at Jackson in order to get to know the school better. You can get general idea about the school by (1) checking previous webinars, (2) join those webinars yourself, or (3) join other admission events listed on the website. So, stay tuned!

Actually, Jackson is trying very hard to reach out to perspective students. I recommend you to go through the previous webinars recording on the website. You can also join future webinars and other events in the future. Please stay tuned!

patterns: When is the deadline for submitting applications?
By when should I submit my application?
When is the deadline of the application?
responses: A great question! I want to really stress that Jackson will NOT accept applications received after the deadline of 11:59pm Eastern Time on 2 January. Of course, it is strongly advised to submit applications well before the deadline in order to avoid the possibility of technical issues in accessing your application

patterns: How can I apply for an application fee waiver, if I meet the eligibility requirements?
How can I get a waiver for the application fee?
If I apply ealier, can I get application fee waivered?
responses: Yes! It is a great question! I will give you this tip so you can save some money. To encourage early applications, Jackson will waive the application fee for all applications received by December 1. A form is not required to receive the waiver. However, remember, no preference will be given to early applications. Of course, you may still apply until our deadline of January 2, but the fee will not be waived automatically for applications submitted after 11:59 pm EST on December 1.

patterns: I applied but my recommendaiton may get there late. What should I do?
I submitted my applicaiton, but my reference may not get there on time.
What happen if my recommendation get submitted late?
responses: I know you are a very busy person. Ideally, all applicaiton materials have to be submitted to the school by the deadline. However, Jackson does not want to penalize you simply because your recommender(s) did not submit it on time. Please let the admission know your situation if that happens.

patterns: If I apply early, my application can get a priority? Like rolling admission?
responses: I am sorry to say this, but Jackson does not have rolling admissions, so if you want to submit their application by December 1, be mindful that it does not improve your chances of admission. Your decision does not go out earlier. All decisions go out in the middle of March and Jackson does have a final application deadline of January 2.

patterns: When is the deadline for test score (GRE) report?
When would be the last day that I can take GRE test?
By when the GRE Test score to be reported?
responses: Thank you for thinking ahead of the plan! I want to be careful here. Jackson requires GRE score, and ideally the score has to be reported by January 2. However, Jackson will most likely accep test score that come in within a week of January. For your information, test scores usually take about 10 to 14 days.  So if you take your tests by the end of December, that's usually sufficient to get them into your application in time to be considered.

patterns: Can the GRE requirement be waived?
Should I take the GRE for my application to be considered?
Should I take the GRE to apply for Jackson?
responses: It is an important question! I know GRE is not the favorite thing for applicants. Unfortunately, general GRE is required for M.P.P. application.

patterns: Why did Jackson introduced masters in public policy M.P.P. programs instead of M.A. in global affairs?
What is the difference between M.A. and M.P.P?
What should we expect from M.P.P. programs?
responses: I get this question a lot! So, I am glad that you raise this question.The Graduate School of Arts and Sciences at Yale is mostly Ph.D. program, so as you're poking around within the application form, you will probably notice that it's very very Ph.D. focused. So Jackson is a professional program we consider our sell our Master's degrees terminal degrees that you can receive these degrees and go out and do international policy and get on the get in the field and go make a difference in the world. That's part of the reason for their change from an MA to an MPP. We wanted to signal that we are professional program, not an academic program toward Ph.D.

Hello Casey, we hope you're well and enjoying your teaching retirement! We just wanted to say thank you so much for this semester, this class was one of our best ever! We feel both very grateful and lucky to have been able to take it. We wish you all the best for all the upcoming projects and look forward to seeing you again very soon !
